question:
Consider the following pairs:
  1. Bibi Ka Maqbara - built by Aurangzeb in memory of his wife
  2. Kabuli Bagh Mosque -  built by Akbar to commemorate his victory over Gujarat
  3. Panch Mahal at Fatehpur Sikri - was commissioned by Akbar
 Which of the above is/are correct?
explanation: The Kabuli Bagh Mosque in Panipat was built in 1527 by the emperor Babur to mark his victory over Sultan Ibrahim Lodhi at the first Battle of Panipat in 1526. Bibi ka Maqbara was built by Azam Shah, son of Aurangzeb, in 1678, in memory of his mother, Dilras Banu Begum. The Panch Mahal was commissioned by sikarwar Rajputs. This structure was used for entertainment and relaxation.
